summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 between Assistant United States Attorney Colleen Mullen, attorney Teri Gibbs, and others, coordinating interviews for two victims of Jeffrey Epstein and discussing a scheduled court hearing regarding the dismissal of the indictment following Epstein's death. It reveals logistical planning for victim interviews and the legal process post-Epstein's death.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York coordinating victim interviews and discussing the upcoming court hearing regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney representing two victims of Jeffrey Epstein, communicating with prosecutors to schedule interviews and coordinate travel and video conference logistics for her clients.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased defendant in case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB); the subject of the victim reports and the indictment scheduled for dismissal.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: Judge presiding over the case who scheduled a hearing regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Epstein and allowed victims to be heard.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: New York attorney who will accompany one of the victims (Ms. [redacted]) to her interview with prosecutors.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Attorney cc'd on the email correspondence regarding the victim reports and interview scheduling.

connections.description: Attorney representing victims coordinating with federal prosecutor regarding victim interviews and court proceedings.
Both are attorneys working together to represent and accompany victims in the Epstein case.
Both attorneys are copied on correspondence regarding victim representation in the Epstein case.
Prosecutor operating within the court jurisdiction of Judge Berman, who is presiding over the Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduled victim interview
events.description: In-person interview scheduled between prosecutors and a victim (Ms. [redacted]), accompanied by her attorney Arick Fudali.

events.title: Scheduled victim video conference
events.description: Video conference interview scheduled between prosecutors and a victim (Ms. [redacted]) located overseas, using Skype.

events.title: Court hearing on indictment dismissal
events.description: Judge Berman scheduled a hearing regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein in light of his death, allowing victims to be heard.

locations: Courtroom 178, 500 Pearl Street courthouse, New York, NY
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Okinawa (mentioned as location of one victim)
keyFacts: The document coordinates interviews for two victims who believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.
A hearing was scheduled for August 27, 2019, to address the dismissal of the indictment against Epstein following his death, with provisions for victims to address the court.
Prosecutors offered victim services, including counseling and travel assistance, to the victims represented by Teri Gibbs.
The attorneys submitted pictures of one victim from 2004 for prosecutors to compare against photos from Epstein's home.
Multiple names of victims and some email recipients are redacted in the document text.
